main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.communication.protocol

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.communication.protocol.Message
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthTokenMessage, MeetingIDMessage

    public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a 'message' sent during the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol. It contains a 'signal' which indicates the purpose of the message and a 'payload' which is the content of the message itself. The message 'signal' denotes the format of the message 'payload'
    Author:
    Psymj1 (Marcus)
    See Also:
    VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message(java.lang.String signal, byte[] payload)
      Creates a new Message Adheres to the standard defined by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getNewTransmittableMessage()
      Converts the signal and payload stored in the message to the new message format which includes the ProtocolConfig.ENCODED_END_PAYLOAD_DELIMITER on the end of the payload so the server and client can tell when a message ends
      byte[] getPayload() 
      java.lang.String getSignal() 
      byte[] getTransmittableMessage()
      Converts the signal and payload stored in the message to a valid form as defined by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message(java.lang.String signal,
               byte[] payload)
        Creates a new Message Adheres to the standard defined by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol
        Parameters:
        signal - Must be less than 4 characters Long. Denotes the purpose of the message and the format of the 'payload'
        payload - Must be less than 10000 bytes long. The data to be sent in the message.
        See Also:
        VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

    • Method Detail

      • getTransmittableMessage

        public byte[] getTransmittableMessage()
        Converts the signal and payload stored in the message to a valid form as defined by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol
        Returns:
        Returns a byte array which represents the data the signal and payload stored in the object
        See Also:
        VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

      • getNewTransmittableMessage

        public byte[] getNewTransmittableMessage()
        Converts the signal and payload stored in the message to the new message format which includes the ProtocolConfig.ENCODED_END_PAYLOAD_DELIMITER on the end of the payload so the server and client can tell when a message ends
        Returns:
        Returns a byte array which represents the data the signal and payload stored in the object
        See Also:
        VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

        public java.lang.String getSignal()
